poem:
"Politics as Still Life"

In the silent morning,
between promises of tax cuts,
a clamour stirs.

Beneath the red hats,
grey civil servants wield their calculators
against an ocean deep budget.

The institutes re-promote,
a scheme, a plan, questions blooming,
fruit on a vine.

Politics strung against the daylight,
an odd assortment,
a still life,
caught in words,
auspicious in its unabashed audacity.
